{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe the anatomy of the falx cerebri and its surrounding blood vessels. The article on cavernous angioma of falx cerebri mentions that the tumor was attached to the lower edge of the falx cerebri, suggesting a close relationship between the tumor and the falx cerebri. The articles on the anterior falcate artery describe its origin from the anterior ethmoidal artery and its course in the parietal dura of the superior sagittal sinus, suggesting that it may be related to the falx cerebri.
